title: Eddie Jones explains shock George Ford decision ahead of Australia showdown
text:
George Ford has impressed during England’s World Cup campaign but has been dropped to the bench for the quarter final against Australia (Picture: Getty)

England head coach Eddie Jones insists George Ford will still have a crucial role to play against Australia on Saturday, despite sensationally dropping the in-form fly half to the bench ahead of Saturday’s quarter final.

Owen Farrell, struggling for form having been deployed at centre so far during the tournament, will wear the No.10 shirt, but Jones is confident Ford is still capable of playing a decisive role as an impact substitute.

‘We don’t see it as dropping,’ Jones told Sky Sports News. ‘I know the media does – but we see him as playing a different role.

‘He is going to finish the game for us, and have an equally important role as when he was starting.

Owen Farrell will start at No.10 for England against Australia (Picture: Getty)

‘We have a number of other players in our squad of 31 who are disappointed, but they are all professional enough.

‘They have got a great team spirit and they know they have got a role to play.

‘Everyone has got a role to play on the Saturday, even our guys outside the 23.

‘George understands the role he has to play. Obviously he would have liked to start but he is coping with it well.’

Shunting Farrell to his favoured position, meanwhile, means Henry Slade will partner Manu Tuilagi in the midfield, while Billy Vunipola is fit to line up at number eight.
